article.para: The purpose of this document is to install a Ulteo OVD Gateway on a Ubuntu 10.04 (Lucid Lynx).

section.title: Prerequisites

listitem.para: A installed Ubuntu 10.04 (Lucid Lynx) system (x86 or amd64).
An internet connexion that allow HTTP or the Ulteo OVD DVD to install debian packages.
An Ulteo OVD Session Manager and Application Server installed and configured.

important.para: The Application Server system have to be a dedicated system for Ulteo OVD usage. It can also hosts another Ulteo OVD roles. But we don't garantees the system will works if you are using another services on this system.
In this document, we are using sm.ulteo.com for the Session Manager address.
You need to set that names according to your own domain names.

section.para: All operations need to be done as super user.

listitem.para: To log in as root: $ sudo -s

section.title: Online method
section.para: The following method describe the repository process when your servers can access to Internet. If not, please read the offline method.

listitem.para: Edit the /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ulteo-ovd.list file and add this line:

important.para: You have to replace LOGIN and PASSWORD by your own.

listitem.screen: deb http://archive.ulteo.com/ovd/3.0/ubuntu lucid main deb http://LOGIN:PASSWORD@archive.ulteo.com/ovd/3.0/gold/ubuntu lucid main

listitem.para: The offline repository are two archives you can download from the Ulteo website here and there, or from the Ulteo OVD DVD and copy it in the /root of your machine.
Edit the /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ulteo-ovd.list file and add these lines:
listitem.screen: deb file:///root/ovd-3.0-ubuntu-lucid lucid main deb file:///root/ovd-3.0-gold-ubuntu-lucid lucid main

note.para: GPG errors given by the previous command will be fixed in the next installation steps. They won't prevent the installation to succeed.
